'''''I, Palantir'' (April 1964), issue 3''' is an issue of the fanzine ''[[I-Palantir]]''.

==Contents==

*"[[The Parting of Arwen]]" by Elfride Rivers, a pseudonym of [[Marion Zimmer Bradley]]
*"Haiku Portraits" by Don Studebaker, Ted Johnstone, and others (only one Haiku, in [[Tengwar]] and English)
*"Ethical Patterns in ''The Lord of the Rings''" by Patricia Meyer Spacks (reprinted from ''Critique'' 3:1)
*"No Monroe in Lothlorien" by Arthur Weir (reprinted from ''Triode'' #17, with some of the comments it drew there, including [[Letter to the editor of Triode|those made by Tolkien in a letter to the editor of ''Triode'']])
*"Hobbits and Heroes" by Anthony Curtis (short article with extracts from [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview with J.R.R. Tolkien]], reprinted from [[The Sunday Telegraph (10 November 1963)|the Sunday Telegraph, November 10, 1963]])<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=51460|articlename=I, Palantir. April 1964|dated=|website=TB|accessed=1 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://fanlore.org/wiki/I_Palantir|articlename=I Palantir|dated=7 September 2012|website=[http://fanlore.org Fanlore.org]|accessed=1 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienguide.com/modules/wiwimod/index.php?page=IPalantir3|articlename=I Palantir #3, 1964|dated=26 May 2008|website=Guide|accessed=1 April 2014}}</ref>
